name: Vivid Memories Recovery Test
description:
This game was made under 72 hours as a part of MiniGameJam 54 : Memories 

Welcome to  Vivid™ Memories Recovery Test,

By doing these few simple test Vivid™ will recover your lost memories, It wil even dispose your body after it's done store it in a Quantum Disk Drive, How™ Convenient™ is that.

Vivid™

An Artificial Intelligence designed by ALTER™  INC, used to recover memories of a crime suspect who's memories/mental has been damaged.

Using the  state of the art  BSPR™ Algorithm or Brain Signal Pattern Recognizer Vivid™ can access someones memory by just  doing a simple test .

The Game

Vivid™ Memories Recovery Test is a memorization game, If you don't have a good memories feel free to use a note or anything else in that matter. 

Please note that this game is still very much unpolished overall & a lot of part was rushed to fit the timeline of the jam including The Main Menu and The Ending.

These are thing that are planned but removed entirely due to time constraint.

- Fully voiced the AI.(if you wanna volunteer for it, you can contact me on discord). 

- More endings.

- Better looking AI.

- An actual good looking menu that doesn't look like it was made less than 10 seconds. 

I will try my best to implement these in the future .  .  .

CONTROLS

This only applied to the "end" part of the game,

the first part of the game is just a simple -LMB- to interact.

-WASD to move.

-SHIFT to sprint.

-Mouse to look around.

My Experienced with The Jam

(You don't need to read past this if you just wanna play the game)

The theme for this gamejam  was MEMORIES .   

I tried my best to come up with game idea that I actually able to do as I just started very recently.  Luckily it's is very simple theme so I've come up with these simple quiz game about memorizing stuff. I tried making a The Watson-Scott Test styled game and somehow still failed.

Noticed the emphasis on simple there, turns out it takes me about a day to create a dialogue system.

The limitation for this gamejam was that it Start & End with different genre,This gave me a headache as it's essentially means creating 2 different game. 

Originally I was going to made it into a 2D Platformer as that's the only thing that I can do at the moment,but I quickly realized that it has been overdone to death a million time already.  Luckily(again) I can just drag & drop fps controller and add some cryptic & absract  looking level, Walking simulator done.

I was stressed out at the fact there isn't much time left and I've only done about halfway through the plan. As a results, a lot of thing we're rushed, at this point I don't even care that no one will play the game. I'm already too Impressed at the fact that I even somehow managed to finish this project at all. 

That's was my first experience with a game jam, I learned a lot of things mainly-

Time management &

The Ending

If you already played the game, you're probably confused by the ending . that's because with the 5 minute length game that I made, there's a whole novel worth of story. 

If you've already played my my previous game you know that I made more emphasize to the story to cover up the lack of gameplay. . .

That being said feel free to game theory your way out to my discord at ヨル#8524
